keysOnPage.title: Keys on this page
keysOnPage.text:
⚠️ IMPORTANT: This website NEVER stores your secret key!

The Secret Key displayed here only exists in your browser (lokal im Arbeitsspeicher). As soon as you reload or leave the page, it is permanently lost.

Copy or note down the Secret Key immediately after generation, before closing the page.

Verification: You can verify using the browser developer tools (F12 → Network) that no secret key is transmitted externally. Only signed transactions are sent, never your Secret Key.

secureKeys.title: Secure secret key
secureKeys.text:
The public key can be safely shared – it is like an account number.

The secret key is the access to your account. Treat it like a password:
• NEVER store it in cloud services, emails, or insecure notes
• Write it down on paper or use a hardware wallet
• Create multiple backups and store them in secure, separate locations
• If the secret key is lost, access to the account is irrevocably lost

multisigSection.title: Multisig (Multisig)
multisigSection.text:
With multisig, you can define multiple signers for your account. Transactions then require signatures from multiple keys (z. B. 2 von 3).

Advantages:
• Enhanced security (ein kompromittierter Key reicht nicht)
• Shared accounts (z. B. Firmen, Partnerschaften)
• Emergency recovery (mehrere Backups bei verschiedenen Personen)

CAUTION: Test multisig on the testnet first before deploying it on the mainnet! Incorrect configuration can lead to losing access to the account.

activateHint: Activation is necessary for the account to exist. In the testnet, it's done via Friendbot, and in the mainnet, it's done via "Create Account" from an existing wallet.

mainnetActivateNote: Note: Additional reserves are needed for multisig. 1 XLM is often not enough.
signersCountHint: You set the minimum number of signatures below under "Required Signatures" (niedrig/mittel/hoch).
signersCountLimit: Note: Network boundary (Stellar): max. 20 additional signatories.
thresholdCurrent: Currently selected: low={{low}}, medium={{med}}, high={{high}} out of {{total}} signatures
thresholdHelp: Threshold: The number of required signatures (master + signers) for a transaction to be valid.
thresholdLevelsHint: Typically, the following applies: low = simple changes (e.g., memo, price), medium = payments/trade, high = security-critical changes (e.g., signer/thresholds).
thresholdTooHigh: Note: A threshold must not exceed the sum of the weights. Please adjust the values accordingly.

tooltips.masterWeight: Weight of the account holder (Master) (0-255): The master key of the account has a voting right. The higher its weight, the more votes its signature counts. These votes are tallied along with the votes of other signatories to check if the required majority is reached.
tooltips.signerWeight: Weight of the signers (0–255): Additional signers also have voting rights. The weight determines how many votes their signature contributes. When a transaction is sent, all submitted votes are added together. If the specified minimum number of votes (Threshold) is reached, the transaction is considered authorized.
tooltips.signerWeightHint: Note: Master and signer weights add up to the sum; thresholds (niedrig/mittel/hoch) must not exceed this sum.

muxedInfo: The Muxed-ID is used to create an M-Address (M...). It points to the same account as the regular address (G...).
muxedIdInvalid: The Muxed-ID must be an integer between 0 and 18,446,744,073,709,551,615.
muxedActivationInfo: Muxed addresses are alias addresses. They do not need to be activated separately.
